text:
~try removing the /embed/ part of the url~

strike that: try inserting the video url you get from a normal visit to the video on YT

Hello <@U03AKL6Q1B2>,

 We were having a conversation in the community about issues with the standard sandbox and custom modules not loading.

Here's a recap of that conversation:

 "After getting the main account imported to a new sandbox, it was set to use the same theme and then some pages needed to be recreated since pages are not imported. While creating the pages I noticed that most of the custom modules were missing and could not be loaded onto the pages, even though the files existed in the theme. This was from within the "Website pages" where you can use "Add new module" on the left side of the interface. The strange thing is that there are a couple custom modules showing up, but I don't see a difference between those and the ones that are missing."

 The modules in the Sandbox have different IDs than the ones in the main account. I noticed that early on but didn't think it would create any issues or cause them to not be visible in the "Website pages" section.

 I recently decided to test creating new versions of the "missing" custom modules in the Sandbox to see if the new ones would be visible. So far it doesn't look like it's working, but I need a little more time to try out a few more and make sure.

Originally I was looking for a way to make small updates to pages, mostly from within custom modules, without cluttering up the main account with clones. I was also looking at the Content Stating tool, but it's only for pages so I'd have to clone all the modules and swap them on the pages in the tool, which means cluttering up the main account.

Thanks for recommending that I create an account in Slack. It will be much easier to ask questions here than posting them in the community.

AdrianF
^^ you can't use the embed URL, you just need to use the public URL

<@U25PYL3Q8> tagging you in here for a little help...since you're level 30 and all :wink:

HS Support was directing <@U07DXTA87L6> to use Content Staging (hmm) instead of helping with a Sandbox to Production issue - I thought you'd be the best person to help with managing CLI between Sandbox and Pro to get to the bottom of these modules missing.
<@U03AKL6Q1B2> I’m level -30 — I’m actually backwards with the points

So <@U07DXTA87L6> — When using a sandbox I think the best way to migrate a theme is to copy it from one portal to another, and not have HubSpot migrate them.  Give me a few minutes here and I’ll see if I can create a video
Haha, totally missed the negative, but I'm pretty sure you'll be of more help than me :crossed_fingers:
CLI is one one, copying iwth design manager is by far the best

Overall if you don’t want to watch the video — relying on HubSpot to migrate what you want over in a sandbox is super hit or miss. I will always delete out whatever is in the sandbox and manually send it over by using the CLI or the design manager

Now, there is a way that when migrating the theme over and using the CLI into a fresh account, I believe you can also do some really cool stuff with the content/pages api where you can actually copy over the website pages and landing pages. I’ve done some of that in the past, it takes a bit of work but is super nice if you need to port a bunch of pages over.

Sometimes the IDs get a bit wonky, and I can’t remember which method the copying of the pages is —
congrats on the mentor stuff — that is exciting
I hope you have lots of fun with that
I just lost a point because that was supposed to be a private message <@U03AKL6Q1B2>
Hahaha :joy: re: the point, I saw these on my phone and thought they were a DM until I saw the thread. TGIF :woman-shrugging::skin-tone-3:
excatly. I’ve had long days every day this week and just got off my last client call
